clinical_study.brief_title: A Study Extension Period of PEG-somatropin (Pegylated-somatropin) in the Treatment of Children With Idiopathic Short Stature
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2 Study Extension Period of Pegylated Somatropin (PEG-somatropin) in the Treatment of Children With Idiopathic Short Stature: An Open, Non-controlled Observational Study.

collaborator.agency: The First Affiliated Hospital with Nanjing Medical University
The Children's Hospital of Zhejiang University School of Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: After the first stage (52 weeks) of Phase II clinical trial, Pegylated recombinant human growth hormone (PEG-rhGH) injection of appropriate dose in compliance with ISS clinical treatment strategy is used to treat children with ISS (Idiopathic Short Stature). The long-term efficacy and safety of the investigational product are evaluated, which can provide more scientific and reliable medication guidance information for clinical diagnosis and treatment.

primary_outcome.description: Change of yearly height velocity before and after treatment. Yearly Height Velocity=12×(Height Yx - Height at Baseline)/(Date of Yx - Date of Baseline)(Yx refers to the height value at particular timepoint x)

secondary_outcome.measure: Standard deviation score of height at the actual age (ΔHT SDS)
secondary_outcome.description: Standard deviation score of height at the actual age.
Change fo Bone maturation before and after treatement (bone age/chronological age)
Change of IGF-1 SDS before and after treatement

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes of standard deviation scores of body mass index (ΔBMI SDS)
secondary_outcome.description: Changes of standard deviation scores of body mass index

secondary_outcome.measure: The yearly average dose of PEG-rhGH injection
The improvement of FH compared with the baseline predicted adult height (PAH)

secondary_outcome.description: For subjects who reach NAH with treatment but fail to follow-ups before reaching FH, the improvement of NAH in comparison with the baseline PAH (predicted adult height) shall be evaluated
For subjects who fail to reach NAH with treatment and fail to follow-ups before reaching FH, the improvement of PAH in comparison with the baseline PAH shall be evaluated

secondary_outcome.measure: The changes of the scores evaluated by the Quality of Life Scale
The changes of lean body mass (LBM) (optional)
The changes of the percentage of body fat (optional)
The changes of bone mineral density (BMD) (optional)

arm_group.description: After the first stage (52 weeks) of Phase II clinical trial, the initial medication dose of this extension period is 0.2 mg/kg weight/week of PEG-rhGH for the high dose group, low dose group and negative control group, and it is adjusted in accordance with yearly height velocity (HV) and IGF-1 SDS of each visit. The maximum dose shall not exceed 0.4 mg/kg weight/week.
